div.p: This plugin allows users to interact with the Internet Information Services (IIS) server and accomplish tasks such as managing servers, web sites and virtual directories.

Supported IIS version
This plugin was developed and tested with IIS 6.0.
To enable Commander to communicate with your IIS installation, create a IIS configuration, supplying the following information:

ul.li: Configuration Name - Provide a unique name for the configuration, keeping in mind that you may need to create additional configurations over time.
IIS IP Address - Provide the URL for the IIS server, it must include the protocol and port (example: http://192.168.1.100).
IIS Port - Provide the port for the IIS server (example: 8081).
Computer Name - Provide the computer name or IP address without backslashes (for example: server01 or 192.168.1.100).
Credential - Provide the username and password for the IIS server.
IIS Version - Select the compatibility mode for IIS version to be used.

div.p: See the Commander online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill-in the fields as follows:

The CheckServerStatus subprocedure checks the status of the specified server.
CheckServerStatus has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration.
usecredentials - Indicate if credentials must be used.

div.p: The CreateVirtualDirectory subprocedure creates a new virtual directory in the specified web site. CreateVirtualDirectory has the following fields:

ul.li: absolutephysicalpath - Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the virtual directory you want to create.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisvdir or c:/windows/system32/iisvdir.vbs).
virtualdirname - Provide the name for the virtual directory.
virtualpath - Provide a path, if necessary, to the virtual directory within the web site.
website - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site of the virtual directory you want to create.

div.p: The DeleteVirtualDirectory subprocedure deletes a virtual directory in the specified web site. DeleteVirtualDirectory has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisvdir or c:/windows/system32/iisvdir.vbs).
virtualdirname - Provide the name for the virtual directory.
virtualpath - Provide a path, if necessary, to the virtual directory within the web site of the virtual directory you want to delete.
website - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site of the virtual directory you want to delete.

div.p: The CreateWebSite subprocedure creates a web site configuration on a local or remote computer running a member of the Windows Server 2003 family with IIS 6.0. CreateWebSite has the following fields:

ul.li: absolutephysicalpath - Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the web site you want to create.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisweb or c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs).
hostheader - Provide the host header name for the web site.
startapp - Indicate if web site must be started after creation.
website - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to create.

div.p: The StartWebSite subprocedure starts a web site. StartWebSite has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisweb or c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs).
sitename - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to start.

div.p: The PauseWebSite subprocedure pauses a web site. This is similar to stopping, except pausing allows existing processes to continue to their conclusion. PauseWebSite has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisweb or c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs).
sitename - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to pause.

div.p: The StopWebSite subprocedure stops a web site. StopWebSite has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisweb or c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs).
sitename - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to stop.

div.p: The DeleteWebSite subprocedure deletes a web site. DeleteWebSite has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisweb or c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs).
sitename - Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to delete.

div.p: The StartServer subprocedure starts a server using the iisreset utility. StartServer has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisreset or c:/windows/system32/iisreset.exe).

div.p: The StopServer subprocedure stops a server using the iisreset utility. StopServer has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisreset or c:/windows/system32/iisreset.exe).

div.p: The ResetServer subprocedure stops and starts a server using the iisreset utility. ResetServer has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
execpath - Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step (for example: iisreset or c:/windows/system32/iisreset.exe).

div.p: The StartIISServices subprocedure starts the necessary services to initialize the IIS server. StartIISServices has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.

div.p: The StopIISServices subprocedure stops the necessary services to shut down the IIS server. StopIISServices has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server.
